title:
Relativistic Quantum Field Theory Approach to Wavepacket Tunneling: Lack
  of Superluminal Transmission
authors:
M. Alkhateeb, X. Gutierrez de la Cal, M. Pons, D. Sokolovski and A.
  Matzkin
abstract:
We investigate relativistic wavepacket dynamics for an electron tunneling
through a potential barrier employing space-time resolved solutions to
relativistic quantum field theory (QFT) equations. We prove by linking the QFT
property of micro-causality to the wavepacket behavior that the tunneling
dynamics is fully causal, precluding instantaneous or superluminal effects that
have recently been reported in the literature. We illustrate these results by
performing numerical computations for an electron tunneling through a potential
barrier for standard tunneling as well for Klein tunneling. In all cases (Klein
tunneling \ or regular tunneling across a standard or a supercritical
potential) the transmitted wavepacket remains in the causal envelope of the
propagator, even when its average position lies ahead of the average position
of the corresponding freely propagated wavepacket.
